metadata.Title: CVE-2021-0448 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
[Unknown description]

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-0448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-aws - 4.4.0-1082.86
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1100-azure - 4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1

notes.Note: Debian> Duplicate of CVE-2020-25211, Android Security team contacted sbeattie> looks like Android updated their bulletin to correctly reflect CVE-2020-25211.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1082.86').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1').
